docs.lead_paragraph: As many Chinese citizens now work in Africa, Chinese officials have urged health authorities to check for fevers in people arriving from the continent.

headline.seo: China Moves to Prevent Spread of Yellow Fever From Africa
headline.main: Yellow Fever: China Plans to Scan Travelers From Sudan
headline.print_headline: Yellow Fever: China Plans to Scan Travelers From Sudan

docs.abstract: Chinese officials are urging health authorities to scan all travelers arriving from Sudan for yellow fever in effort to prevent epidemic.
docs.snippet: As many Chinese citizens now work in Africa, Chinese officials have urged health authorities to check for fevers in people arriving from the continent.

docs.lead_paragraph: A simple kit that works like a pregnancy test could prove helpful in more rapidly diagnosing an illness controllable with antibiotics if caught early.
docs.abstract: Simple kit that works like pregnancy test could prove helpful in rapidly diagnosing cases of bubonic plague; illness, which remains particular threat in Africa, is controllable with antibiotics if caught early.
docs.snippet: A simple kit that works like a pregnancy test could prove helpful in more rapidly diagnosing an illness controllable with antibiotics if caught early.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ten years after a couple from New Mexico arrived in New York City and became ill with the plague, many aspects of the case still puzzle experts.

headline.seo: Reliving the Nightmare of Plague, 10 Years Later
headline.main: Reliving Nightmare of Plague, 10 Years On
headline.print_headline: Reliving Nightmare Of Plague, 10 Years On

docs.abstract: Case of bubonic plague that sickened Lucinda Marker and John Tull while on a 2002 trip to New York City remains mysterious ten years later; doctors have been unable to determine why Marker was completely cured while Tull nearly died.
docs.snippet: Ten years after a couple from New Mexico arrived in New York City and became ill with the plague, many aspects of the case still puzzle experts.
